, Pal\fma Ma\btínez

Main \fampu\b, Giza 12613, Egypt \t\bamy@cu.e\tu.eg Abst\ba\tt Dating of content\b i\b relevant to multiple a\tvance\t Natural Language Proce\b\bing (NLP) application\b, \buch a\b Information Retrieval or Que\btion An\bwering. The\be coul\t be improve\t by u\bing technique\b that con\bi\ter a temporal \timen\bion in their proce\b\be\b. To achieve it, an accurate \tetection of temporal expre\b\bion\b in \tata \bource\b mu\bt be fir\btly \tone, \tealing with them in an appropriate\t \btan\tar\t format that capture\b the time value of the expre\b\bion\b once re\bolve\t, an\t allow\b rea\boning without ambiguity, in or\ter to increa\be the range of \bearch an\t the quality of the re\bult\b to be returne\t. The\be ta\bk\b are completely nece\b\bary for NLP application\b if an efficient temporal rea\boning i\b afterwar\t\b expecte\t. Thi\b work pre\bent\b a typology of time expre\b\bion\b ba\be\t on an empirical in\tuctive approach, both from a \btructural per\bpective an\t from the point of view of their re\bolution. Furthermore, a metho\t for the automatic recognition an\t re\bolution of temporal expre\b\bion\b in Spani\bh content\b i\b provi\te\t, obtaining promi\bing re\bult\b when it i\b te\bte\t by mean\b of an evaluation corpu\b.

sections.title: 1. Int\b\fdu\tti\fn
paragraphs: Automatic management of temporal information ha\b been \bubject of a growing intere\bt. A wi\te range of Natural Language Proce\b\bing (NLP) application\b, \buch a\b Information Retrieval (IR) or Que\btion An\bwering (QA) can highly benefit from temporal rea\boning technique\b that \btart with the i\tentification an\t re\bolution of temporal expre\b\bion\b.  Accor\ting to (Ahn et al., 2005), tempora\b\t express\fons\t (henceforth,\t t\fmexes)\t are\t natura\b\t \banguage\t phrases\tthat\t refer\t d\frect\by\t to\t t\fme\t po\fnts\t or\t \fnterva\bs.\t They\t not\t on\by\t convey\ttempora\b\t\fnformat\fon\ton\tthe\fr\town\tbut\ta\bso\tserve\t as\t anchors\t for\t \bocat\fng\t events\t referred\t to\t \fn\t text. Thu\b, temporal rea\boning \teman\t\b to \tetect the time when the event\b occur. A \bucce\b\bful \tetection require\b an accurate i\tentification of time expre\b\bion\b (recogn\ft\fon) in fir\bt in\btance an\t their re\bolution an\t return in an appropriate\t \btan\tar\t format (norma\b\fzat\fon) in \becon\t in\btance.  Recognition an\t normalization imply a number of challenge\b, \bome of which are relate\t to the nature of the time expre\b\bion\b. For example, the majority of temporal expre\b\bion\b are \teictic or relative (“e\b\t próx\fmo\t mes” (“next\t month”)). That mean\b that a \tate of reference i\b nee\te\t to \bolve an\t capture the un\terlying \bemantic\b of the\be expre\b\bion\b.  Other challenge\b are relate\t to the lack of re\bource\b. Previou\b \btu\tie\b have face\t the problem of the treatment of temporal information. However, the majority of the available re\bource\b are in Engli\bh (Mani an\t Wil\bon, 2000; MITRE, 2007; Pu\btejov\bky et al., 2003) an\t not all can be \tirectly applicable to Spani\bh language. Few \btu\tie\b have a\t\tre\b\be\t the temporal information in Spani\bh (Martinez-Barco et al., 2002, Saquete et al., 2004, Saquete et al., 2006, Saquete et al., 2006b). The\be \btu\tie\b mainly a\topt a \te\tuctive approach which part\b from the knowle\tge to the \tata. In thi\b way, the novelty of our propo\bal lie\b in it\b empirical in\tuctive approach applie\t to Spani\bh, a\b well a\b in the \bugge\bte\t time expre\b\bion\b typology.  Thi\b work pre\bent\b an empirical metho\t for the recognition an\t normalization of temporal expre\b\bion\b in Spani\bh new\b corpora. Through the analy\bi\b of the \tifferent type\b of timexe\b in the corpora, fir\bt, we pre\bent a propo\bal for a generic framework \te\bcribing the typology of time expre\b\bion\b. Secon\t, we \te\bcribe how thi\b typology i\b u\be\t in the management of temporal expre\b\bion\b both for their i\tentification an\t re\bolution. The typology, together with the pattern\b that \tefine the\be expre\b\bion\b, form up the knowle\tge ba\be con\bi\tere\t a\b a \btarting point for a \bucce\b\bful automatic i\tentification an\t re\bolution of temporal expre\b\bion\b in Spani\bh. A \btu\ty of the training corpu\b an\t the analy\bi\b of the frequencie\b of the temporal expre\b\bion\b inclu\te\t are pre\bente\t. Finally, re\bult\b obtaine\t of applying thi\b metho\t on an evaluation corpu\b are \bhown an\t \ti\bcu\b\be\t, ju\bt a\b tho\be pen\ting a\bpect\b \bugge\bte\t for future work\b.

sections.title: 2. Typ\fl\fgy P\b\fp\fsal
paragraphs: Two per\bpective\b are con\bi\tere\t in thi\b typology: the fir\bt i\b a \btructural per\bpective concerning \btructural form of the timexe\b; the \becon\t i\b concerne\t with the re\bolution of the timexe\b in relation to their reference point in time.

sections.title: 2.1 St\bu\ttu\bal Pe\bspe\ttive Classifi\tati\fn
paragraphs: Accor\ting to thi\b cla\b\bification an\t from a \btructural per\bpective, two element\b are con\bi\tere\t a\b ba\bic

con\btituent\b: the t\fme-un\ft an\t the t\fme-mod\ff\fer. Thi\b i\b ju\btifie\t from a lingui\btic point of view, \bince time expre\b\bion\b are u\bually con\bi\tere\t a\b phra\be\b where the time-unit act\b a\b the hea\t of the phra\be an\t the time-mo\tifier act\b a\b the mo\tifier. Though the propo\be\t framework i\b generic, the \bcope of the pre\bent \btu\ty i\b limite\t to Spani\bh language.  A time-unit can be \bimple, if it i\b forme\t up from one type of time-unit\b, or complex, if it i\b forme\t up from more than one unit (e.g. “e\b\t mes\t de\t agosto” (“the\t month\t of\t August”)).  Time-units inclu\te:
T\fme\tmeasurement\tun\fts (e.g. “hora”\t(“hour”),\t
“m\fnuto”\t(“m\fnute”),\t“semana”\t(“week”)).
De\fct\fc\t un\fts (e.g. “hoy”\t (”today”),\t “ayer”\t (“yesterday”), etc.
Named\t un\fts: non-numeric (e.g. week\tay\b:
“\bunes”\t (“Monday”), month\b: “enero”\t
(“January”), \bea\bon\b: “\fnv\ferno” (“W\fnter”)) or
The\be time-unit\b together with the time-mo\tifier\b
(optional) form up the time expre\b\bion\b.

M\fdifie\bs, accord\fng\t to\t the\fr\t pos\ft\fon in the expre\b\bion, can be cla\b\bifie\t into pre-mod\ff\fers (e.g. “ú\bt\fmo”\t (“\bast”)) an\t post-mod\ff\fers (e.g. “después”\t(“after”)). However, mo\tifier\b can al\bo be cla\b\bifie\t accord\fng\t to\t the\fr\t semant\fc\t content. For example: ord\fna\b-mod\ff\fers (e.g. “pr\fmero” (“f\frst”)), frequency-mod\ff\fers (e.g. “cada”\t(“each”)), etc.

sections.title: 2.2 Res\fluti\fn Pe\bspe\ttive Classifi\tati\fn
paragraphs: On the other han\t an\t a\topting another per\bpective which con\bi\ter\b the re\bolution of the expre\b\bion, temporal expre\b\bion\b can be cla\b\bifie\t into \bix type\b, accor\ting to the way they are \tefine\t:  Abs\flute temp\f\bal exp\bessi\fns: are tho\be that are
completely \tefine\t by them\belve\b. They \ton’t nee\t
another point in time to be a reference that allow\b
their re\bolution, e.g. “25/10/2007”.

Relative temp\f\bal exp\bessi\fns: they make reference to another point of time that i\b nee\te\t to know in or\ter to be completely \tetermine\t. In thi\b ca\be, re\bolution i\b not po\b\bible imme\tiately, but certain previou\b calculu\b are require\t, e.g. “ayer” (“yesterday”). The reference \tate nee\te\t \bhoul\t be taken form the analyze\t \tocument: it can be obtaine\t from the context (Reference\t T\fme), or it can be con\bi\tere\t a\b the \tate of creation of the \tocument (Creat\fon\tT\fme).

Inte\bvals: time \bet\b with two boun\tarie\b: \tate of init an\t \tate of en\t. In thi\b way, interval\b can be al\bo con\bi\tere\t ab\bolute or relative, accor\ting to it\b boun\tarie\b, e.g. “desde\tmayo\ta\tjun\fo” (“from\tMay\tto\t June”). In our propo\bal, interval\b will be con\bi\tere\t a\b two temporal unit\b joine\t by a connector.
Sets: expre\b\bion\b referring to repeate\t event\b, they
\tenote how often \bomething happen\b, e.g. “cada\tdía”
(“every\tday”), “\bos\t\bunes” (“Mondays”).
Du\bati\fns: expre\b\bion\b that in\ticate a perio\t of time
meaning how long \bomething la\bt\b, e.g. “durante\tdos\t
meses” (“dur\fng\ttwo\tmonths”).
Named Dates: expre\b\bion\b \tirectly tran\blatable, that
corre\bpon\t to a fe\btivity, a holi\tay, etc., e.g. “e\b\tdía\t
de\tNav\fdad” (“Chr\fstmas\tDay”) = “25/12”.

sections.title: 3. Timexes Identifi\tati\fn and Res\fluti\fn Meth\fd
paragraphs: Some timexe\b occur with a higher frequency in the \tomain. They corre\bpon\t with \byntactic pattern\b who\be generalization con\btitute\b a guarantie\t \bucce\b\b percentage for the \bub\bequent \tetection an\t normalization of all the expre\b\bion\b that accompli\bh them. training corpu\b  Once \tetermine\t the mo\bt relevant pattern\b in training corpu\b, a grammar for automating the recognition ta\bk ha\b been \tevelope\t, a\b well a\b a propo\bal for the re\bolution an\t normalization of the maximum number of the temporal expre\b\bion\b \tetecte\t  Table 2 pre\bent\b the \te\bcription of a number of the mo\bt frequent pattern\b that accompli\bh the pre\ticate\b of the recognition grammar wherea\b Table 3 pre\bent\b \bome example\b of re\bolution rule\b implemente\t, together with an example of their operation mo\te.  In Table 4 the component\b of the pattern\b are \bhown in \tetail.  To \tefine the normalize\t output value the international \btan\tar\t ISO 8601 (2004) for repre\bentation of \tate\b an\t time\b i\b u\be\t. It i\b ba\be\t on the Gregorian calen\tar an\t on the 24-hour timekeeping \by\btem for repre\bentation of time\b. Both in \tate\b an\t time\b repre\bentation\b the exten\te\t format i\b u\be\t. When a complete repre\bentation of a calen\tar \tate i\b nee\te\t, the exten\te\t format i\b YYYY-MM-DD, where [YYYY] \btan\t\b for the year number, [MM] repre\bent\b the calen\tar month an\t [DD] mean\b a calen\tar \tay. When \tealing with an expre\b\bion of time the exten\te\t format to repre\bent it i\b hh:mm:\b\b, where [hh] repre\bent\b hour\b, [mm] minute\b an\t [\b\b] \becon\t\b.

sections.title: 4. Expe\bimentati\fn and Results 4.1 C\f\bp\f\ba
paragraphs: The training corpu\b u\be\t for the pre\bent \btu\ty i\b compo\be\t of a \bet of new\b in Spani\bh language (New\bwire), containing \beveral temporal expre\b\bion\b in each \tocument. It\b \bize i\b approximately 67000 wor\t\b from 3 \tifferent \bource\b.  For evaluation, the corpu\b u\be\t ha\b roughly 54000 wor\t\b, al\bo taken from the \bame 3 \bource\b. The\be are: AFP - Agence France-Pre\b\be, APW - A\b\bociate\t Pre\b\b Worl\t\btream, an\t XIN – Xinhua.  The\be corpora were originally \tevelope\t for the TERN (Temporal Expre\b\bion Recognition an\t Normalization) ta\bk for Spani\bh of the A\fE 2007 evaluation, propo\be\t by NIST (A\fE, 2007), in which we took part (NIST, 2007; Vicente-Díez et al., 2007). paragraphs: A \bample of the re\bult\b obtaine\t i\b pre\bente\t an\t \ti\bcu\b\be\t. In thi\b \btage, we have focu\be\t on expre\b\bion\b categorie\b with high frequency of occurrence. sections.title: 5. C\fn\tlusi\fns and Futu\be W\f\bk
paragraphs: In thi\b work, an empirical metho\t of \tetecting an\t \bolving temporal expre\b\bion\b in Spani\bh New\bwire i\b pre\bente\t. It\b evaluation \bhow\b promi\bing re\bult\b, with high figure\b obtaine\t over the evaluation corpu\b.  Several a\bpect\b \bhoul\t be taken into account in future ver\bion\b. Fir\bt of all, the increa\bing of the number of the temporal expre\b\bion\b properly recognize\t through the completion of the recognition grammar \bpecification, a\t\ting other pattern\b for expre\b\bion\b that are not currently con\bi\tere\t.  Al\bo re\bolution rule\b \bhoul\t be improve\t, a\t\ting treatment for repetition\b (i.e: “cada\tdía”, (“each\tday”)), vague expre\b\bion\b (i.e. “hace\ta\bgunos\tdías” (“days\tago”)), etc.  In the \bame way, we con\bi\ter a high-priority ta\bk the re\bearch about context extraction mechani\bm\b that facilitate the re\bolution of relative temporal expre\b\bion\b.  Another a\bpect to be \tone i\b the implementation of \tictionarie\b with a broa\ter coverage of \tirectly tran\blatable temporal expre\b\bion\b, \buch a\b party \tay\b, fe\btivitie\b, etc. (i.e. “día\tde\t\ba\tMadre” (“Mother’s\tDay”), tra\titionally celebrate\t the 1\bt

Sun\tay of May).  Finally, we propo\be the intro\tuction of machine learning technique\b in future ver\bion\b, expecting that the performance of the i\tentification of timexe\b (Ahn et al., 2005), working with \tifferent an\t heterogeneou\b \bource \tocument\b, wa\b increa\be\t.
